description: Ms. codex. Title from title page (fol. 2a). 15 lines per page. Written in black ink with use of red for headings. Dark cream paper with laid lines visible. Short text in Persian on fol. 92b. Fāʾidah in Arabic on fol. 94b. Inscriptions in Persian and Arabic on fol. 1a-b and 91b. Inscription on fol. 96b. Ownership statements and seals on fol. 2a and 91a. Three first leaves defective. Leaves missing between fol. 9 and 10, between fol. 67 and 68, and between fol. 76 and 77. Copied in 892 by Isḥāq ibn Muslim al-Ṭālibī (colophon, fol. 91a). Incipit: بسم ... وبه الثقة وعليه التوكل قال ... ابو علي بن عبد الله بن سينا ... الغريزات الاودية التي استمدت الأمواه من العيون Explicit: بيكون عونا لمن يريد استخراج الرويا الغريبة الحقيقة بتوسطها واد قد وفينا بما وعدنا
author: Avicenna, 980-1037
abstract: Defective copy of a treatise on the interpretation of dreams attributed to Avicenna.
extent: 96 leaves : paper ; 127 x 90 (78 x 50) mm. bound to 132 x 98 mm.
title: Kitāb khulāṣat al-taʻbīr
provenance: Acquired from Brill, Leyden, 1925, from the books of Murād Bey Bārūdī (Beirut).
creator: Avicenna, 980-1037
subject: Dream interpretation—Religious aspects—Islam—Early works to 1800
binding_note: Upper and lower covers and envelope flap made of red leather over paper pasteboard. The covers are similarly tooled with a central gold-painted mandorla linked to the outer frame by a vertical blind-tooled fillet. The envelope flap has a blind tooled outer frame similar to that on the covers.
member_of_collections: Princeton Digital Library of Islamic Manuscripts
